intro: Limodorum densiflorum, commonly known as the dense-flowered lily of the valley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern Asia. It features a cluster of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces dense, fragrant clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is closely related to the lily of the valley (Convallaria majalis). It thrives in shady, moist woodland environments and is often found growing in clusters along forest floors. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for shade gardens and conservation efforts.
